name: Buffalo Chicken Chili
author: Lisa Arlotti
summary: I won a blind taste test chili cookoff with this chili against nine traditional beef chilis! Garnish with shredded Tex-Mex cheese, crushed corn chips, and sour cream.
ingredients: 1 large carrot, peeled and finely chopped
½ cup hot buffalo wing sauce (such as Frank's® REDHOT Buffalo Wing Sauce), or to taste
1 (15 ounce) can white kidney or cannellini beans, drained
1 (19 ounce) can red kidney beans, drained
directions: Heat olive oil and butter in a large pot over medium-high heat
Cook and stir 7 to 10 minutes, until chicken is no longer pink

Stir in the carrot, onion, celery, garlic, chili powder, cumin, paprika, and salt and pepper, and cook and stir until the onion is translucent and the vegetables are beginning to soften, 3 to 4 more minutes
Stir in the hot sauce, tomato sauce, crushed tomatoes, and white and red kidney beans
Bring to a boil, and simmer over medium-low heat about 1 hour, until the vegetables are tender and the flavors have blended
